What are genes related to Hyperphenylalaninemia?
PTS, GCH1, QDPR, PCBD1, DNAJC12, PAH

Answer: PTS, QDPR, HPABH4A, HPABH4B, HPABH4C, HPABH4D, PKU, HPANBH4, FEZ1, DNAJC12

Note: The genes related to Hyperphenylalaninemia include PTS and QDPR which are directly associated with the condition. Others like HPABH4A, HPABH4B, HPABH4C, HPABH4D (which refer to different types of BH4-deficient hyperphenylalaninemia), PKU (Phenylketonuria), and HPANBH4 (mild non-BH4-deficient hyperphenylalaninemia) are also related. FEZ1 and DNAJC12 were listed but their direct relation to Hyperphenylalaninemia is less clear from the provided information, as they do not have a locus directly associated with the condition in the summary data.

Answer: PTS, QDPR, HPABH4A, HPABH4B, HPABH4C, HPABH4D, PKU, HPANBH4, FEZ1, DNAJC12

Note: The genes related to Hyperphenylalaninemia include PTS and QDPR which are directly associated with the condition. Others like HPABH4A, HPABH4B, HPABH4C, HPABH4D (which refer to different types of BH4-deficient hyperphenylalaninemia), PKU (Phenylketonuria), and HPANBH4 (mild non-BH4-deficient hyperphenylalaninemia) are also related. FEZ1 and DNAJC12 were listed but their direct relation to Hyperphenylalaninemia is less clear from the provided information, as they do not have a locus directly associated with the condition in the summary data.
